alert.note: Alert for Western Uinta Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 25 at 10:36PM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Myton affecting Western Uinta Basin zone. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to remain high. Possible minor flooding along the Duchesne River near Myton. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Duchesne River near Myton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.4 feet (3364 CFS), fields adjacent to the Duchesne River in and near Myton will experience minor flooding. Additionally, structures and yards along banks may receive minor flood damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 8.2 feet (3010 CFS). - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.4 feet (3364 CFS). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
